definition[0]: to surround a city or castle with military force until the people inside let you take control
example[0]: In April 655, Osmanâ€™s palace was besieged by rebels.
definition[1]: if you are besieged by people, you have a lot of them around you
example[1]: Miller was besieged by press photographers.
explanation[0]: Besiege is usually passive in this meaning
